Cvars.help: list current addon info.

Cvars.name: ai_clear_bad_links
Cvars.help: Clears bits set on nav links indicating link is unusable

Cvars.name: ai_debug_actbusy
Cvars.help:
Used to debug actbusy behavior. Usage:
1: Constantly draw lines from NPCs to the actbusy nodes they've chosen to actbusy at.
2: Whenever an NPC makes a decision to use an actbusy, show which actbusy they've chosen.
3: Selected NPCs (with npc_select) will report why they're not choosing actbusy nodes.
4: Display debug output of actbusy logic.
5: Display safe zone volumes and info.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_dyninteractions
Cvars.help: Debug the NPC dynamic interaction system.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_enemy_position
Cvars.help: Draw a debug line from a selected NPC to its enemy.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_expressions
Cvars.help: Show random expression decisions for NPCs.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_los
Cvars.help: NPC Line-Of-Sight debug mode. If 1, solid entities that block NPC LOC will be highlighted with white bounding boxes. If 2, it'll show non-solid entities that would do it if they were solid.

Cvars.name: ai_debug_node_connect
Cvars.help: Debug the attempted connection between two nodes

Cvars.name: ai_disable
Cvars.help: Bi-passes all AI logic routines and puts all NPCs into their idle animations.  Can be used to get NPCs out of your way and to test effect of AI logic routines on frame rate

Cvars.name: ai_drop_hint
Cvars.help: Drop an ai_hint at the player's current eye position.

Cvars.name: ai_expression_frametime
Cvars.help: Maximum frametime to still play background expressions.

Cvars.name: ai_expression_optimization
Cvars.help: Disable npc background expressions when you can't see them.

Cvars.name: ai_frametime_limit
Cvars.help: frametime limit for min efficiency AIE_NORMAL (in sec's).

Cvars.name: ai_hull
Cvars.help:
Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	NPC name or classname, <none>=NPC under crosshair

Cvars.name: ai_ignore_danger_sounds
Cvars.help: NPCs will not react to danger sounds (eg. run away from grenades about to explode)

Cvars.name: ai_next_hull
Cvars.help:
Cycles through the various hull sizes.  Currently selected hull size is written to the screen.  Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	-none-

Cvars.name: ai_no_select_box
Cvars.help: Don't draw bounding box of selected NPCs. ( 0 = selection box, 1 = no selection box, 2 = small selection cross instead)

Cvars.name: ai_nodes
Cvars.help:
Toggles node display.  First call displays the nodes for the given network as green objects.  Second call  displays the nodes and their IDs.  Nodes are color coded as follows:
	Green		- ground node
	Cyan		- air node
	Magenta	- climb node
	Grey		- node not available for selected hull size
	Orange 	- node currently locked

Cvars.name: ai_resume
Cvars.help: If NPC is stepping through tasks (see ai_step ) will resume normal processing.

Cvars.name: ai_set_move_height_epsilon
Cvars.help: Set how high AI bumps up ground walkers when checking steps

Cvars.name: ai_setenabled
Cvars.help: Like ai_disable but you manually specify the state (with a 0 or 1) instead of toggling it.

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_crawl
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_fly
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_connect_jump
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_graph_connect
Cvars.help: Toggles graph connection display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are connected to the selected node by the net graph will be drawn in red with magenta lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not connected via the net graph from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

Cvars.name: ai_show_grid
Cvars.help: Draw a grid on the floor where looking.

Cvars.name: ai_show_hints
Cvars.help:
Displays all hints as small boxes
	Blue		- hint is available for use
	Red		- hint is currently being used by an NPC
	Orange		- hint not being used by timed out
	Grey		- hint has been disabled

Cvars.name: ai_show_hull
Cvars.help:
Displays the allowed hulls between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Arguments: 	-none-

Cvars.name: ai_show_node
Cvars.help: Highlight the specified node

Cvars.name: ai_show_visibility
Cvars.help: Toggles visibility display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are visible from the selected node will be drawn in red with yellow lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not visible from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

Cvars.name: ai_step
Cvars.help: NPCs will freeze after completing their current task.  To complete the next task, use 'ai_step' again.  To resume processing normally use 'ai_resume'

Cvars.name: ai_test_los
Cvars.help: Test AI LOS from the player's POV

Cvars.name: ainet_generate_report

Cvars.name: async_serialize

Cvars.name: async_simulate_delay

Cvars.name: async_track_all

Cvars.name: async_track_entity_io

Cvars.name: budget_history_range_ms

Cvars.name: budget_panel_bottom_of_history_fraction
Cvars.help: number between 0 and 1

Cvars.name: budget_panel_height

Cvars.name: budget_panel_width
Cvars.help: width in pixels of the budget panel

Cvars.name: budget_panel_x

Cvars.name: budget_peaks_window
Cvars.help: number of frames to look at when figuring out peak frametimes

Cvars.name: budget_show_averages
Cvars.help: enable/disable averages in the budget panel

Cvars.name: budget_show_history
Cvars.help: turn history graph off and on. . good to turn off on low end

Cvars.name: budget_show_peaks
Cvars.help: enable/disable peaks in the budget panel

Cvars.help: Automatically swaps the current weapon for the bug bait and back again.

Cvars.name: cc_linger_time

Cvars.name: cc_minvisibleitems

Cvars.name: cc_showblocks

Cvars.name: cc_showmissing

Cvars.name: cc_subtitles

Draw a bbox

Break in debugger when missing resource match is found.
Format: cl_break_on_missing_resource <substring> /(empty to break on all) / 0 to turn off.

Cvars.name: cl_burninggibs
Cvars.help: A burning player that gibs has burning gibs.

Cvars.name: cl_cache_sendtable
Cvars.help: Cache sendtables

Cvars.help: Index of the bone to follow.  -2 == disabled.  -1 == root bone.  0+ is bone index.

Cvars.name: cl_chat_wipehistory
Cvars.help: Wipes chat history after all chat text faded out

Cvars.name: cl_chatfilters
Cvars.help: Stores the chat filter settings

Cvars.name: cl_class
Cvars.help: Default class when joining a game

Cvars.name: cl_clearhinthistory
Cvars.help: Clear memory of client side hints displayed to the player.

Cvars.name: cl_clock_correction
Cvars.help: Enable/disable clock correction on the client.

Cvars.name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount
Cvars.help: Sets the maximum number of milliseconds per second it is allowed to correct the client clock. It will only correct this amount if the difference between the client and server clock is equal to or larger than cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset.

Cvars.name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset
Cvars.help: As the clock offset goes from cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset to this value (in milliseconds), it moves towards applying cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount of adjustment. That way, the response is small when the offset is small.

Cvars.name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset
Cvars.help: If the clock offset is less than this amount (in milliseconds), then no clock correction is applied.

Cvars.name: cl_clock_correction_force_server_tick
Cvars.help: Force clock correction to match the server tick + this offset (-999 disables it).

Cvars.name: cl_clock_showdebuginfo
Cvars.help: Show debugging info about the clock drift.

Cvars.name: cl_clockdrift_max_ms
Cvars.help: Maximum number of milliseconds the clock is allowed to drift before the client snaps its clock to the server's.

Cvars.name: cl_clockdrift_max_ms_threadmode
Cvars.help: Maximum number of milliseconds the clock is allowed to drift before the client snaps its clock to the server's.

Cvars.name: cl_cloud_settings
Cvars.help: Cloud enabled from (from HKCU\Software\Valve\Steam\Apps\appid\Cloud)

Cvars.name: cl_cmdrate
Cvars.help: Max number of command packets sent to server per second

Cvars.name: cl_connectionretrytime
Cvars.help: Number of seconds over which to spread retry attempts.

Cvars.name: cl_consistencycheck
Cvars.help: Triggers the client to perform a consistency check

Cvars.name: cl_consistencycheck_interval
Cvars.help: Perform a consistency check after this amount of time (seconds) has passed since the last.

Cvars.name: cl_customsounds
Cvars.help: Enable customized player sound playback

Cvars.name: cl_debug_player_use
Cvars.help: Visualizes +use logic for the given range. Green cross=trace success, Red cross=trace too far, Green box=radius success

Cvars.name: cl_debugoverlay_toggle
Cvars.help: Toggles visibility of the debug overlay system.

Cvars.name: cl_demoviewoverride
Cvars.help: Override view during demo playback

Cvars.name: cl_destroy_ragdolls

Cvars.name: cl_dormant_spew

Draws line between two 3D Points.

Cvars.name: cl_drawmaterial
Cvars.help: Draw a particular material over the frame

Cvars.name: cl_dumpsplithacks

Displays the total bounding box for the given entity(s) in green.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.

Cvars.name: cl_ent_attachments

	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

Displays the movement bounding box for the given entity(ies) in orange.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.

Find and list all entities with classnames or targetnames that contain the specified substring.

Display data for entity matching specified index.

Cvars.name: m_customaccel
Cvars.help:
Custom mouse acceleration:
0: custom accelaration disabled
1: mouse_acceleration = min(m_customaccel_max, pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent) * m_customaccel_scale + sensitivity)
2: Same as 1, with but x and y sensitivity are scaled by m_pitch and m_yaw respectively.
3: mouse_acceleration = pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent - 1) * sensitivity

May unexpectedly change behavior or crash the game, because game code is generally unaware of underlying resource reloads and may hold references to physics that may become invalid during resource reload. It is inherently harder for physics to deal with resource reloads because of persistent nature of objects being simulated (textures can be easily reloaded on the fly; if an entity holds a handle to a ragdoll body part, it may expect that handle to stay valid while the ragdoll exists)
